abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second
            Transmission and Distribution project for Vietnam are: a)
            alleviate power shortages and improve the quality of power
            supplies by improving transmission and distribution network
            capacity; b) raise transmission and dispatch efficiency and
            improve power system reliability; and c) promote and support
            the reform and restructuring of the electricity sector. This
            Resettlement Plan (RP) defines resettlement and compensation
            programs for project affected persons (PAPs). In this regard
            the following mitigation measures will be applied: 1)
            acquisition of land and other assets, and resettlement of
            people will be minimized as much as possible; 2) all PAPs
            residing, working, doing business or cultivating land in the
            right of way (ROW) of transmission lines, surrounding areas
            of tower foundations, substation areas, service roads will
            be provided with rehabilitation measures to assist them to
            improve or at least maintain their pre-project living
            standards, income earning capacity and production levels; 3)
            previous level of community services and resources will be
            maintained or improved; replacement of residential and
            agricultural land will be as nearby as possible to the land
            that was lost, and acceptable to the PAPs; 4) plans for
            acquisition of land and other assets and provision of
            rehabilitation measures will be carried out in consultation
            with the PAPs to insure minimal disturbance; 5)
            institutional arrangements will ensure effective and timely
            design, planning, consultation and implementation of the RP;
            and 6) finally, effective and timely supervision,
            monitoring, and evaluation of the implementation of the RP
            will be carried-out.
